content:
Congratulations on updating your name with the Social Security Administration!

Now, let's go through the online process of submitting Form PS 3575 to update your address with the USPS:

**Step 1: Gather required documents and information**

* Your new Social Security card with your updated name
* Proof of identity (driver's license, state ID, or passport)
* Proof of residency (utility bill, lease agreement, or bank statement with your new address)
* Your old and new addresses
* Your email address and phone number

**Step 2: Visit the USPS website**

Go to the official USPS website at [www.usps.com](http://www.usps.com).

**Step 3: Click on "Change of Address"**

In the top-right corner of the webpage, click on "Change of Address" under the "Quick Tools" section.

**Step 4: Fill out the online form**

You'll be directed to the "Change of Address" page. Click on "Get Started" to begin the online application.

Fill out the online form with the required information, including:

* Your old and new addresses
* Your name (make sure to use your updated name)
* Your email address and phone number
* Your identity information (driver's license, state ID, or passport)

**Step 5: Upload supporting documents**

You'll need to upload your supporting documents, including:

* Your new Social Security card with your updated name
* Proof of residency (utility bill, lease agreement, or bank statement with your new address)

Make sure the documents are clear and legible. You can upload them in PDF, JPEG, or PNG format.

**Step 6: Review and submit**

Review your application carefully to ensure everything is accurate. If you need to make any changes, you can go back to the previous steps.

Once you're satisfied, click "Submit" to complete the application.

**Step 7: Receive confirmation**

You'll receive an email confirmation from the USPS once your application has been submitted successfully. You can also track the status of your application online.

That's it! The USPS will update your address in their system, and you'll begin receiving mail at your new address.

If you encounter any issues or have questions during the process, you can contact the USPS customer service at 1-800-275-8777 or visit your local post office for assistance.
